turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: He needs a room, Dusty.

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: I reckon I can hear him...  ...Room rate's eight sixty-six a day plus sales tax, plus extra for the TV option.

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: I reckon I can hear him. TV option, that's a dollar twenty, makes nine eighty-six plus tax.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Tell him the channels, Dusty.

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: Channels, we got two and six. Two don't come in so hot.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Sure don't.

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: See, Wednesday's the special on RC Cola. I don't know if I explained about the TV option. If there's a TV in the room, you got to pay the option.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: And how many room got TV, Dusty?

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: Ever durned one.

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: Hold it, hold it. What's tonight?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: What night is it?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: ...Friday?

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: Right. Friday night is Yankee night. Where're you from?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Lubbock?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: ...He gave me a little pearl-handled .38 for out first anniversary.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: ...Figured I'd better leave before I used it on him. I don't know how you can stand him.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Well, I'm only an employee, I ain't married to him.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: ...I don't know. Sometimes I think there's something wrong with him. Like maybe he's sick? Mentally?... Or is it maybe me, do you think?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Listen, I ain't a marriage counselor. I don't know what goes on, I don't wanna know... But I like you. I always liked you...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: ...What're you gonna do in Houston?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: I'll figure something out... How come you offered to drive me in this mess?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I told you. I like you.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: See, I never knew that.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Well now you do.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: ...Hell.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: ...You know that car?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: I don't know... I just think maybe I'm making a mistake...

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: ...What was that back there?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Back where?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Sign.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I don't know. Motel... Abby--

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Ray. Did you mean that, what you said before, or were you just being a gentleman?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Abby, I like you, but it's no point starting anything now.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I mean, I ain't a marriage counselor--

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: What "what"?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Am I fired? You wanna hit me? What?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: I don't particularly want to talk to you.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Well... if you're not gonna fire me I might as well quit.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Fine. Suit yourself.  ...Having a good time?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Then what'd you come here for?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You owe me for two weeks.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: ...You get a refund though, if you tell me who else she's been sluicing.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I want that money. If you wanna tell me something, fine--

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: What're you, a fucking marriage counselor?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: What did you take these for?

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: What do you mean...

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: ...Just doin' my job.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: You called me, I knew they were there, so what do I need these for?

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: Well, I don't know... Call it a fringe benefit.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: How long did you watch her?

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: Most of the night...

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: Now that don't make much sense.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: No. It just made them feel better.

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: ...Anything else?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Yeah, don't come by here any more. If I need you again I know which rock to turn over.

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: ...That's the test, ain't it? Test of true love--

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Got a job for you.

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: ...Well, if the pay's right and it's legal I'll do it.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: It's not strictly legal.

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: If the pay's right I'll do it.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: It's, uh... it's in reference to that gentleman and my wife. The more I think about it the more irritated I get.

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: Yeah? Well how irritated are you?

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: ...Gee, I'm sorry to hear that. Can you tell me what you want me to do or is it a secret?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Listen, I'm not--this isn't a joke here.

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: You want me to kill 'em.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: I didn't say that.  Well?

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: Well what?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: You're an idiot.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: So, uh... this wouldn't interest you.

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: I didn't say that. All I said was you're an idiot. Hell, you been thinking about it so much it's driving you simple.

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: I'm supposed to do a murder--two murders--and just trust you not to go simple on me and do something stupid. I mean real stupid. Now why should I trust you?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: For the money.

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: The money. Yeah. That's a right smart of money...

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: ...There's a big--

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: I want you to go fishing.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: ...What?

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: Go down to Corpus for a few days. Get yourself noticed. I'll give you a call when it's done... You just find a way to cover that money.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Yeah. Is it...

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: Ya catch any fish?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: ...What?

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: Ya catch any fish?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: ...What kind of fish?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Listen, what is it? Is it done?

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: Just the ten thousand'll be fine.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Got something to show me first?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Dead, huh?

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: So it would seem.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: ...What did you do with the bodies?

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: It's taken care of. The less you know about it the better.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Jesus, I don't believe it...

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: Something I got to ask you, Marty. I've been very very careful. Have you been very very careful?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: Nobody knows you hired me?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: ...I just made a call about that. It'll look fine.

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: I must've gone money simple. This kind of murder...

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: ...it's too damn risky.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Then you shouldn't have done it. Can't have it both ways.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: ...Count it if you want.

turns.speaker: VISSER
turns.text: Nah, I trust ya.

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: Yeah, I know. Pour 'em short.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Has Ray come in yet?

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: No, he's off tonight. Where was he last night?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: How would I know?

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: I don't know, didn't he call?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: You said the usual--

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Red Label.

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: Right. Sorry.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Pour that back.

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: What.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Don't throw that out.

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Deuce in the corner needs help.

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: What.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: This.

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: Jack Daniels. Don't worry, I'm paying for it.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: That's not the point.

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: What's the point?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: The point is we don't serve niggers here.

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: Where?  ...I'm very careful about that.

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: ...I thought you were dead. Going home?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: No. I think I'll stay right here in hell.

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: Kind of a bleak point of view there, isn't it Marty?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Meurice...

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: ...I don't want that asshole near my money. I don't even want him in the bar.

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: We get a lot of assholes in here, Marty.

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: Howdy stranger.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Meurice. Sorry I didn't show last night.

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: Wasn't too busy. You missed a good one, though. This white guy walks in about one o'clock, asks if we have a discount for alcoholics... I tell him to get lost, but Marty's sitting here listening and I can tell he's thinking that maybe it ain't such a bad idea...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Is Marty here?

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: Not here tonight. Wasn't here last night. He's especially not back in his office.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Thanks Meurice.

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Got a problem, Meurice?

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: No, you do, cowboy. You been to the bar?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: ...Why?

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: You shouldn't have taken the money...

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: ...and Abby. Maybe. But as far as I'm concerned that only leaves one fucking possibility.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: Where was I?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: You we telling me about the Ring of Fire.

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: Yeah, well, I may be getting in over my head here, I mean you're the geologist, but my theory for what it's worth, you got all these volcanoes and each time one pops it's the equivalent of what, twenty, thirty megatons of TNT?  Enough to light Las Vegas for how long?  How many years? Course, I'm no mathematician but--

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: What day is it today, Angie?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Tuesday.

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: Tuesday is ladies' night.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: Tuesday night is ladies' night. All your drinks are free.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I sent a trunk home yesterday. This is all I have.

turns.speaker: AUNT BARBARA
turns.text: You look good, Jeffrey. Did you have a nice flight?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah. How's Dad?

turns.speaker: AUNT BARBARA
turns.text: I think it's important not to get depressed. Depression is a terrible thing. They say it can bring on illness.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Aunt Barbara. I'll try not to get depressed.

turns.speaker: AUNT BARBARA
turns.text: Jeffrey. you're not going down by Lincoln, are you?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: No. I'm just going to walk around the neighborhood. Don't worry.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Doctor Gynde. my whole family's sick. What's going on?

turns.speaker: AUNT BARBARA
turns.text: I'm not sick.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Will you tell Mom when she gets home from the hospital that I've gone to dinner at Sandy Williams' house?

turns.speaker: AUNT BARBARA
turns.text: Okay honey. that sounds nice. Jeffrey. I think you've got termites in the house.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Oh yeah?. Have you seen any?

turns.speaker: AUNT BARBARA
turns.text: I've seen a few.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Well, I haven't seen any. I wouldn't worry about it. Look. I better go.

turns.speaker: AUNT BARBARA
turns.text: Okay honey.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I don't want to talk about it. Everything's okay now. I don't want to talk about it.

turns.speaker: AUNT BARBARA
turns.text: Sometimes it helps to talk things over. for instance, many marriages are saved by.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Aunt Barbara. I love you, but you're not gonna get it.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Frank. Come in.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Hey, I brought some friends. and some beer.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Fine. Welcome. Come sit down.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Suave. goddam are you suave, you fucker. You want some beer?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Certainly Frank.  Darling, get some glasses. We'll have some beer with Frank. Won't you sit down?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Shit Ben! How the shit are ya?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Fine Frank. Fine. How are you?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Fuckin' good, real fuckin' good. You know this little tid bit, Dorothy, and this thing, here,  is a neighbor. What the shit we're doin' with a neighbor, I don't know. goddam!!! This is the suavest guy I know. look at you. You're one beautiful fucker, Ben. I love this jacket and that cigarette holder of yours. shit, that is too fuckin' much. Where's those glasses. this beer's gonna get too warm. I can't stand fuckin' warm beer. it makes me puke.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Darling, where are the glasses?. Oh. here they are.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: To your health, Frank.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Shit. let's drink to something else. let's drink to fuckin'. Say here's to your fuck Frank.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: If you like Frank. Here's to your fuck. cheers.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Frank, I have something for you. Excuse us everyone.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: EXCUSE US por favor! Hey. let Tits see her kid.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: See you Tuesday, Frank.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Right Ben. LET'S GO FUCK. I'll fuck anything that moves.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Are you Detective Williams?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: My name is Jeffrey Beaumont - I live near you. I believe you know my father, Tom Beaumont - Beaumont's Hardware Store?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: Sure I do. I understand he's in the hospital. How is he?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: He's alright, I guess. I hope. They're doing tests, that's why I'm home from school. I was over at the hospital this morning and I was going home and in the field behind our neighborhood. there behind Vista, I found an ear.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: You did? A human ear?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah. I've got it here in this bag. I thought I should bring it to you.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: Yep, that's right. Let's take a look at it.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: By the way, Jeffrey, this story isn't going to the press and I'm going to ask you to consider all you've heard strictly confidential. Do not discuss this business with anyone, but me, or other police personnel. Got it?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Got it. Thanks for letting me in on as much as you did.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: Come on. I'll drive you home. It's on my way.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: Come into the study a minute.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Excuse me, Mrs. Williams.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: Detective Williams here. yeah. Tell him to go to Sergeant Milton. yeah, copy.  Well, Jeffrey, you found something which is very interesting to us. Very interesting. I know you must be curious to know more.  But. I'm afraid I'm going to have to ask you not only not to tell anyone about your find, but also not to ask more about the case. One day. when it's all sewed up, I'll let you know all the details. Right now, though. I can't.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I understand. I'm just real curious like you said.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: I was the same way when I was you age. I guess that's what got me into this business.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: It must be great.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: And it's horrible too.  I'm sorry Jeffrey. That's the way it has to be. Anyway. I'm sure you do understand.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: Jeffrey?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: If you want to come up a minute, I'll show you some pictures.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: These are beautiful. How's the case coming?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Anything you can tell me?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: The criminals are winning.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Is that why you say it's horrible?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I guess you've seen some bad things.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: Yes I have - so bad I wouldn't poison your mind by telling you.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Why do you do it?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: I won't let the bastards get me up against the wall. It's an act of defiance.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah. I get it.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: What is this? What color is it?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: Blue. It's Blue Velvet.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: What color is it?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: It's blue. blue velvet.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: Jeffrey! Come on in.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Hi. Hi Sandy. I'm sorry to bother you, but I've got to talk to you.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: Okay. come on in. Looks like you had a bad face lift.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: Okay?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Okay. I gotta tell you. I've. discovered some things. .Anyway I have to show you some pictures and tell you some things about them. The first picture is this.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: And that man came out with a third man - this well-dressed guy. here's the photo. I think a girl named Dorothy Vallens is in trouble with these people. I think Frank has taken her husband and her son.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I have no hard proof of any of this. Her address is also on the photos. I think these people are involved with drugs. and murder. I think Frank is killing drug dealers and.  . and somehow Frank is getting all their drugs. I had to tell you I got slightly more involved in this than you wanted me to, but it's over now for sure. .I had to tell you about these things in case it could help.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: Well now Jeffrey, how did you come to get so involved?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I can't tell you the whole story. I. I took it upon myself. I can't say more.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: Is Sandy part of this?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: No. not at all.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: Who knows you have these?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Only you. and the photo lab.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: You're all through with this now?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: For now. Alright. you better be. And Sandy better not be involved with this, I can tell you. Be prepared to come in for further interrogation on this later.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Detective Williams!! Detective Williams!!

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: Detective Williams here. Is that you, Jeffrey?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yes it's me!!! Frank is on his way up to Dorothy's apartment.  Oh no. Frank has a radio and is hearing everything we say!!  Detective Williams. hurry. I'm in the apartment. hurry. I'm hiding in the back bedroom.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: We're ten minutes away and moving as fast as we can.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: Because of your information I alerted internal affairs to check out Detective Gordon.  I had to keep on with him as if nothing was different.  He slipped off on his own when he found out we were going to raid Frank's place.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Does Dorothy know her husband is dead?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE WILLIAMS
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Oh my God. Is her son OK?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Hello, baby.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Shut up. It's daddy. shithead.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Hello, daddy.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: . my bourbon.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: . MOMMY!.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: . mommy's here.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Baby wants to fuck.

turns.speaker: FRANK
